title: Whoever you were, you were right.
body:
A wise man once said J4 would get nerfed before Lee Sin.

He was right.

And even better, they nerfed the wrong thing.

My sweet sweet Lee Dong, may you forever be the strongest of them all.

replies.body:
Riot, I am noticing a trend here............

http://www.quickmeme.com/img/9b/9b3ec2629194a2642105cfc73c1d3abfc7e7f4468871d26725b9dbb53786ca94.jpg

...................................
Isn't the meme relevant to every other Lee Sin QQ post?
Interesting J4 has been the way he is for about a year and they nerf him.......

I'd rather Lee stay as he is as I collect my free wins.
When playing against him that is.

That's because all the LeeSin hype has caused huge amounts of people to play him because they think he is an easy win, in reality LeeSin is a rather high skill floor champion and these kids usually don't know what they are doing.

Ever fought a good LeeSin, like a smurf or at high-elo? It's miserable. He Q's to you whenever a matchup is in his favor, he kicks you away farther than Tristana's ult when it isn't, and if your team ever catches him out, he will just wardhop over a wall, or to a champion and get a nifty shield.

You can tell a good LeeSin from a bad one just by what he is building.

A bad LeeSin builds straight damage and tries to nuke with Q+R+Q.

A good LeeSin builds {{item:3074}} {{item:2045}} and the rest straight tank and CDR and becomes an absolute bitch for your team to deal with, while still being able to duel effectively.

He does too much and is too strong at everything he can do. He is capable of doing well in top lane, a good LeeSin can dominate mid, he can be infuriating to deal with if he goes support because of his safeguard, true vision, and kick-away, and of course he is a top tier jungler who can farm for a very long time while still being the strongest counterjungler in the game.

lmao, Lee sin has a 45% win rate in diamond. It's not like his win rate rises with player skill.
Also, if you are playing against a smurf, I'm pretty sure you'd be miserable no matter what he played.
Lee Sin isn't hard to beat

To be fair a lot of people said that.
And we were right.
